Sentencas: In-situ neutron diffraction was utilized to study the influence of Y-doping on the crystal structure, oxygen non-stoichiometry, and oxygen anion transport pathways in Sr1-xYxCoO3-delta at temperatures and oxygen partial pressures typical of SOFC cathode conditions, from 500 degrees C to 800 degrees C, and oxygen partial pressure, pO(2), between 10(-3) atm and 1 atm.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions

Sentencas: The resulting diffraction patterns of Sr0.9Y0.1CoO3-delta and Sr0.8Y0.2CoO3-delta were fit to tetragonal space groups P4/mnun and I4/numn, respectively.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions

Sentencas: While prior reports have suggested a degree of superstructuring in these materials at room temperature, our elevated temperature data demonstrates that this is not present under SOFC conditions.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions

Sentencas: Both materials show similar oxygen stoichiometry with preferential oxygen vacancy formation at the equatorial sites of the Co-centered octahedra.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions

Sentencas: While these equatorial sites are equivalent in Sr0.9Y0.1CoO3-delta, further vacancy localization within Sr0.8Y0.2CoO3-delta leads to a structure consisting of vacancy rich and vacancy poor Co-centered octahedra alternating in the c-axis direction.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions

Sentencas: Both structures suggest a sinusoidal oxygen anion transport pathway via the high vacancy sites, further localized to the alternating vacancy rich layers in Sr0.8Y0.2CoO3-delta.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions

Sentencas: A secondary vacancy ordered Brownmillerite phase was observed at 600 degrees C and below at the lowest pO(2) for Sr0.9Y0.1CoO3-delta.
Titulo: Oxygen vacancy localization and anisotropic oxygen anion transport in Sr1-xYxCoO3-δ (X=0.1, 0.2) under solid oxide fuel cell cathode conditions
